column4: Im having a little trouble with Ubuntu, When i installed it inside-windows the instatlation worked perfectly, however, it installed fine, and i was able to log on once to Ubuntu. (im using the live cd version at the moment) BUt when i try to do it now it goes to the loading screen stops and i get a command line "Busy box v.1.3 Debain 1.1.1-5ubuntu12 Built in shell (Ash) Initramfs
your kernel isn't being loaded
How can i make it load?
did you opt out of installing grub when you installed ubuntu?
when you installed ubuntu, did you specifically tell it NOT to install GRUB?
if you don't know, the answer is most likely "no" :)
Well i installed it directly through WUBI so there was no option about that, i can still go back into windows, too bad its screwed up.
ok. so when you first start your computer, you have the option to pick between windows and ubuntu?
Correct

ok, can you send me your /boot/grub/menu.lst? i realize you can't boot into Ubuntu, one really quick way to grab it might be to install imaginary fs from www.fs-driver.org so you can mount your ext3 in Windows
Can i install Ubuntu and dual-boot with windows with WUBI?
Because i installed WUBI in Windows-Safemode
why in safe mode?
Idk why but one day i logged on WIndows and it was always crashing and lagging, but when i poped in the ubuntu live cd everything worked fine, thats why in safe mode
installing wubi in safe mode is not recommended
I didn't realy have much of a choice
might be time to reinstall and fix Windows then. Because installing it in safe mode is not likely to result in a workable environment
Any idea on how to reinstall windows without its disc
you can't.
unless you have some kind of recovery partition on your hard drive
